text: hey guys it's angel today I had a huge
craving for kanji so I thought I would
show you guys how to make a Taiwanese
down dried radish egg omelette which is
oftentimes served with congee but you
can also eat it with rice now if you
haven't had dried radish before it's
actually a turnip and it's the same turn
up that we use in my turnip cake recipe
but it's been preserved so it's very
salty very crunchy but it's really good
in this egg omelette recipe this dish is
a very traditional Taiwanese side dish
and I'm calling this a side dish because
you'll want to serve this with
vegetables or meats it's definitely part
of a big family style meal so with that
let's get started on the ingredients
this recipe calls for five simple
ingredients I'm starting with three eggs
two cloves of garlic which I've minced
earlier one stock of green onions which
I've cut up
angle will also mean three tablespoons
of dried radish now you can usually find
this at your local Asian grocery store
and it can either come pre chopped like
I have here or you can buy a full piece
where it's uncut now before you use the
radish you'll want to soak it in water
for about 20 to 30 minutes and the
reason why is because it's really salty
so soaking it in water takes a bit of
the saltiness out and finally you want
one teaspoon of soy sauce first start by
lightly beating your eggs then add your
soy sauce and then your green onions
reserving some green onions for
garnishing later next pre-heat your
frying pan on medium low heat and add a
bit of oil then add your dried radish
and saute for a minute or two to release
the flavors add your garlic and after
that add your egg mixture
tilt your pan if needed to ensure that
the egg is spread evenly then let it
cook and brown for two to three minutes
once the edges have started to brown use
a spatula or two to help them flip the
omelette let that cook for another
minute to lightly Brown the other side
then remove and cut into pie shaped
pieces place your egg omelette on a
plate garnished with the remaining green
onions and serve with a bowl of hot
congee
so this is how you make a tyranny style
dried radish egg omelet
it's very delicious very satisfying with
a bowl of hot Kayne also good with the
bowl of hot rice and what I like best
about it is that take a bite into the
egg omlet bite into the radish respect
texture and that crunch it's super
delicious well I hope you guys enjoyed
this video don't forget to subscribe to
my channel
angel Wong's kitchen and I will see you
guys next time bye super crunchy
